snippet: The Dutch shipping company TNT Express agreed on Friday to sell its airline operations as the European company looks to win regulatory support for its proposed 5.2 billion euros ($6.6 billion) takeover by United Parcel Service.
abstract: The Dutch shipping company TNT Express agreed on Friday to sell its airline operations as the European company looks to win regulatory support for its proposed 5.2 billion euros ($6.6 billion) takeover by United Parcel Service.

headline.main: TNT Express to Sell Airline Unit Ahead of U.P.S. Takeover
